intro: Heptapleurum dongnaiense var. dongnaiense, commonly known as the Dong Nai heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Vietnam and parts of Laos. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
